battles: 1969 Libyan coup d'état Libyan–Egyptian War Chadian–Libyan conflict Uganda–Tanzania War First Liberian Civil War 1986 United States bombing of Libya Libyan Civil War | honorific-prefix    = Colonel
term_end: On 15 July 2011, at a meeting in Istanbul, more than 30 governments, including the United States, withdrew recognition from Gaddafi's government and recognized the National Transitional Council (NTC) as the legitimate government of Libya.

On 23 August 2011, during the Battle of Tripoli, Gaddafi lost effective political and military control of Tripoli after his compound was captured by rebel forces. Staff (23 August 2011). http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/libya-aug-23-2011-1819 "''Libya Live Blog'': Tuesday, 23 August 2011 – 16:19". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 23 August 2011.
On 25 August 2011, the Arab League proclaimed the anti-Gaddafi National Transitional Council to be "the legitimate representative of the Libyan state".
